meanings.definition: A large fish-eating bird of prey with long wings and a white underside.
meanings.sent1: The ospreys soared high in the sky, searching for their next meal.
meanings.sent2: I saw a pair of ospreys diving into the water to catch fish.
meanings.sent3: The ospreys decided to have a fishing competition to see who could catch the most.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was like that of the ospreys hunting for food.
meanings.sent5: The ospreys' sharp talons and keen eyesight make them skilled hunters.

meanings.sent1: We set out early in the morning to ospreys in the nearby forest.
meanings.sent2: He loves to ospreys on weekends for fun and relaxation.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended to ospreys each other in a playful game.
meanings.sent4: She tried to ospreys the elusive ospreys but they were too quick for her.
meanings.sent5: The hunter patiently waited to ospreys the majestic ospreys in the wild.
